generatedBy: Ana SUPERIA (DeepSeek Coder) - Supervisé et complété par Claude

skills.name: CREATE TABLE
skills.description: Create a new table in the database
skills.pattern: CREATE TABLE users (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(100));

skills.name: ALTER TABLE
skills.pattern: ALTER TABLE users ADD COLUMN email VARCHAR(255) UNIQUE;

skills.name: DROP TABLE
skills.description: Remove a table from the database
skills.pattern: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS users CASCADE;

skills.name: SELECT Query
skills.pattern: SELECT id, name FROM users WHERE active = true ORDER BY name;

skills.name: INSERT Data
skills.description: Add new rows to a table
skills.pattern: INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES ('John', 'john@example.com') RETURNING id;

skills.name: UPDATE Data
skills.description: Modify existing rows in a table
skills.pattern: UPDATE users SET email = 'new@example.com' WHERE id = 1;

skills.name: DELETE Data
skills.pattern: DELETE FROM users WHERE created_at < NOW() - INTERVAL '1 year';

skills.name: B-tree Index
skills.description: Default index type for equality and range queries
skills.pattern: CREATE INDEX idx_users_email ON users(email);

skills.name: GIN Index
skills.description: Generalized Inverted Index for full-text and JSONB
skills.pattern: CREATE INDEX idx_data_gin ON documents USING GIN (content);

skills.name: GiST Index
skills.description: Generalized Search Tree for geometric and range types
skills.pattern: CREATE INDEX idx_geo_gist ON locations USING GIST (coordinates);

skills.name: Primary Key
skills.pattern: ALTER TABLE users ADD CONSTRAINT pk_users PRIMARY KEY (id);

skills.name: Foreign Key
skills.pattern: ALTER TABLE orders ADD CONSTRAINT fk_user FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(id);

skills.name: BEGIN Transaction
skills.pattern: BEGIN; UPDATE accounts SET balance = balance - 100 WHERE id = 1;

skills.name: COMMIT
skills.pattern: COMMIT;

skills.name: ROLLBACK
skills.description: Abort current transaction and undo changes
skills.pattern: ROLLBACK;

skills.name: ACID Properties
skills.pattern: SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL SERIALIZABLE;

skills.name: MVCC Concurrency
skills.pattern: SELECT xmin, xmax, * FROM users; -- View transaction IDs

skills.name: JSONB Storage
skills.description: Store and query JSON binary data
skills.pattern: SELECT data->>'name' FROM documents WHERE data @> '{"type": "article"}';

skills.name: JSONB Operators
skills.description: Query JSON with containment and existence
skills.pattern: SELECT * FROM products WHERE attributes ? 'color' AND attributes->>'color' = 'red';

skills.name: Full-Text Search
skills.description: Text search with tsvector and tsquery
skills.pattern: SELECT * FROM articles WHERE to_tsvector('english', content) @@ to_tsquery('postgresql & database');

skills.name: Table Partitioning
skills.description: Split tables by range, list, or hash
skills.pattern: CREATE TABLE logs (id SERIAL, created DATE) PARTITION BY RANGE (created);

skills.name: Streaming Replication
skills.pattern: primary_conninfo = 'host=master port=5432 user=replicator'

skills.name: Logical Replication
skills.pattern: CREATE PUBLICATION my_pub FOR TABLE users, orders;

skills.name: PgBouncer
skills.pattern: [databases] mydb = host=127.0.0.1 port=5432 dbname=mydb

skills.name: PostGIS
skills.pattern: CREATE EXTENSION postgis; SELECT ST_Distance(geom1, geom2) FROM locations;

skills.name: pg_trgm
skills.pattern: CREATE EXTENSION pg_trgm; SELECT * FROM users WHERE name % 'John';

skills.name: Common Table Expression
skills.pattern: WITH recent AS (SELECT * FROM orders WHERE date > NOW() - '7 days') SELECT * FROM recent;

skills.name: Window Functions
skills.pattern: SELECT name, salary, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY dept ORDER BY salary DESC) FROM employees;

skills.name: Stored Procedures
skills.pattern: CREATE FUNCTION get_user(uid INT) RETURNS TABLE(name TEXT) AS $$ BEGIN RETURN QUERY SELECT name FROM users WHERE id = uid; END; $$ LANGUAGE plpgsql;

skills.name: EXPLAIN ANALYZE
skills.pattern: EXPLAIN (ANALYZE, BUFFERS, FORMAT TEXT) SELECT * FROM users WHERE email = 'test@example.com';
